byline.contributor: Adam Goldman and Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting.
byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG, MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Former colleagues of Lt Gen Michael T Flynn, Donald Trump's pick for national security adviser, say he alienated superiors and subordinates and tolerated no dissent during his brief tenure as Defense Intelligence Agency head; warn that such qualities, combined with conspiratorial worldview, could prove problematic for national security adviser, particularly one tasked with mediating conflicting views among cabinet secretaries and agencies for president with no experience in defense or foreign policy issues.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Past colleagues paint a mixed picture of a man who will have nearly unfettered access to the Oval Office and help guide President Trump on world events.
snippet: Past colleagues paint a mixed picture of a man who will have nearly unfettered access to the Oval Office and help guide President Trump on world events....

headline.main: In Trump’s Security Pick, Michael Flynn, ‘Sharp Elbows’ and No Dissent
headline.print_headline: In Security Pick, ‘Sharp Elbows’ and No Dissent
